meanings.definition: To make (someone or something) tranquil or calm.
meanings.sent1: The soothing music tranquilized the baby, helping her fall asleep peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The therapist tranquilized the anxious patient with gentle words and a warm smile.
meanings.sent3: The magical lullaby tranquilized the rowdy group of children, turning them into peaceful little angels.
meanings.sent4: The serene landscape tranquilized her mind, washing away all worries and stress.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of the nurse tranquilized the scared puppy, easing its fears instantly.

meanings.definition: To administer a tranquilizer to (someone or something) in order to induce a state of tranquility or calmness.
meanings.sent1: The vet tranquilized the nervous dog before the surgery to keep it calm and relaxed.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper tranquilized the agitated elephant to safely transport it to a new enclosure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tranquilized the zookeeper by stealing his tranquilizer gun and playing with it.
meanings.sent4: The tranquilizer dart tranquilized the wild bear, allowing researchers to study it without harm.
meanings.sent5: The tranquilizer injection tranquilized the roaring lion, making it docile and easy to handle.
